intro: Oreobolus goeppingeri, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Oreobolus goeppingeri is adapted to arid conditions and is an important component of its native ecosystems.
